title: Now there’s a robot that keeps your plants alive
content:
Macworld

What do you do when your basil plant’s leaves are turning yellow? And why does the rosemary look like that? When it comes to herb gardening, who has the thyme to sit down and become an expert? Instead, let Plantum identify what’s wrong with your plants, tell you when to water them, and all the other little care instructions your plant desperately needs. And it’s only $14.97 for a lifetime subscription. 

Your plants deserve this

Here’s how Plantum turns you into a pro gardener. This app’s AI can identify over 33,000 plant species, but it doesn’t just name them. It can also diagnose ailments and provide tailored care advice to help your plants thrive. Turns out, your tomato’s shriveled leaves are just because you haven’t watered it in two weeks. 

Plantum’s light meter feature is particularly useful for assessing whether your plants are in the optimal spot for sunlight exposure. 

While your plants grow, you can also use Plantum to track their progress and read more gardening tips. You’ll have a green thumb in no time. And if you don’t, then it’s a good thing Plantum never expires.
